definition: half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: How do you like the steak served, wee - done or underdone?
sentences.chinese: 她用半生不熟的咸肉和烧焦了的饼干招待我们。
我不要半生不熟的牛排。

sentences.english: This meal is only half cooked .
These potatoes are only half cooked.
sentences.chinese: 这些土豆煮得半生不熟。

sentences.english: I don't care for half-cooked beefsteak.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢吃半生不熟的牛排。

sentences.english: She served us underdone bacon and burnt biscuits.
sentences.chinese: 她用半生不熟的熏肉和烧焦了的饼干招待我们。

sentences.english: I hate my interpersonal relationship, if you can please complete care.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌半生不熟的人际关系，如果可以请彻底的在乎。

sentences.english: This "half-knowledge" is the most dangerous in my oppinion.
sentences.chinese: 这些“半生不熟的知识”是我观念中最危险的部分。

sentences.english: The chicken is a bit undercooked.

definition: half-cooked/(fig.) not completely done, solved, developed etc/Taiwan pr. [jia4 sheng5]
half-cooked rice/(fig.) half-finished job that is difficult to complete because it was not done properly in the first instance/Taiwan pr. [jia4 sheng5 fan4]
to wolf down one's food (idiom); to devour ravenously/to gorge oneself
a full mouth of (sth physical)/to have the mouth exclusively filled with (a certain language, lies, promises, etc)
